definition: year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: The ancient tower still stops up,exposed to the weather for ages.
sentences.chinese: 经过长年累月的风吹日晒，那座古塔依然竖立在那里。

sentences.english: Clouds of smoke and steam filled the air for ever and ever .
sentences.chinese: 空气里长年累月充满着缭绕不绝的浓烟和蒸气。

sentences.english: The cataract is flattening the huge stone all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 翻译大瀑布长年累月地冲刷着巨石。

sentences.english: Year in year out he has been doing fieldwork in the Northwest.
sentences.chinese: 他长年累月在大西北从事野外工作。

sentences.english: The profound erudition of the writer came from long years of study.
sentences.chinese: 这位作家渊博的学问来自长年累月的钻研。

definition: variant of 長年累月|长年累月[chang2 nian2 lei3 yue4]
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
to accumulate over a long period of time
scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
(idiom) to be exposed to the elements
over time/as time passes/in the fullness of time
to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
